summary: I spent the greater chunk of yesterday playing Gravity Rush, after which we went to go see Spiderverse in theaters, and those...
body:
I spent the greater chunk of yesterday playing Gravity Rush, after which we went to go see Spiderverse in theaters, and those two things back to back had a pretty significant effect on me.

namely, I have a very rabid and completely unattainable desire to SWING WILDLY FROM TALL OBJECTS and SOAR WITHOUT A CARE THROUGH THE SKY, @ GOD IF WE’RE THE APEX PREDATOR WHAT’S WITH THESE CHAINS WE CALL GRAVITY HOLDING US BACK YOU DUMB ASSHOLE

summary: Who would you fancast as the rest of the Spider-Family/Spider-Verse in the MCU?
question: Who would you fancast as the rest of the Spider-Family/Spider-Verse in the MCU?
answer:

Kiernan Shipka as Gwen Stacy/Spider-Gwen

Andrew Garfield as Ben Reilly

Tobey Maguire as Kaine Parker

Joseph Gordon Levitt as Noir Spider-Man/Peter Parker

Oscar Isaac as Spider-Man 2099/Miguel O’Hara

Shailene Woodley as Spider-Girl/Mayday Parker

Yvonne Strahovski as Arachne/Julia Carpenter

Jessica Lange as Madame Webb

title: PSA
body:
Into the Spider-Verse is a fantastic movie and I highly recommend it!  Every second is visually breathtaking, original, and well written.  One of the best movies I’ve seen this year, actually.

That being said, if you’re sensitive to light flashes and blurred movement like I am, it might give you a headache.  The animation style is designed to be comic book-esque, which is AWESOME, but keep that in mind if you see it on the big screen.  I had to sit in the dark like all last night after I got back - it was 100% worth it, but I figured I’d pass it along in case this is a concern for anyone else.

Enjoy and take care of yourselves, lovelies!

reblog.comment:

Enjoy and take care of yourselves, lovelies!

That being said, if you’re sensitive to light flashes and blurred movement like I am, it might give you a headache.  The animation style is designed to be comic book-esque, which is AWESOME, but keep that in mind if you see it on the big screen.  I had to sit in the dark like all last night after I got back - it was 100% worth it, but I figured I’d pass it along in case this is a concern for anyone else.

Enjoy and take care of yourselves, lovelies!

Into the Spider-Verse is a fantastic movie and I highly recommend it!  Every second is visually breathtaking, original, and well written.  One of the best movies I’ve seen this year, actually.

That being said, if you’re sensitive to light flashes and blurred movement like I am, it might give you a headache.  The animation style is designed to be comic book-esque, which is AWESOME, but keep that in mind if you see it on the big screen.  I had to sit in the dark like all last night after I got back - it was 100% worth it, but I figured I’d pass it along in case this is a concern for anyone else.

Enjoy and take care of yourselves, lovelies!

summary: Can I just say I have visions of Melinda May “babysitting” Peter Parker for whatever, unknown, reason and I can't help but find...
body:
Can I just say I have visions of Melinda May “babysitting” Peter Parker for whatever, unknown, reason and I can’t help but find it HILARIOUS – Peter being all weird and awkward, and Melinda - season 1 Melinda - being all stoic and unamused. 

Peter trying to do tai-chi with her and he’s just clumsy and keeps losing his balance… Someone tell me they see this too?

summary:
Last weekend, my friends made a “Spider-Chan” joke. So this happened.
I think her arms are still mechanical (probably made as an...
body:
Last weekend, my friends made a “Spider-Chan” joke. So this happened.

I think her arms are still mechanical (probably made as an research assistant at Octavius/Tako industries). But they’re filled all the way with web fluid, the same way the turrets in Portal are jammed full of bullets. Irresponsibly crammed.

summary: Research findings. Reference images obtained. (Thank you to the friendly neighborhood photographer who sent them my way. I’ll...
body:
Research findings. Reference images obtained. (Thank you to the friendly neighborhood photographer who sent them my way. I’ll keep you anonymous, as requested.)

Because look, I’m gonna keep drawing Liv, but I can’t fill up a tag on my own.

Okay I COULD. But. I want more.
